aboutUs.name: 1. We value academic staff and students with strong potential. Our society is not indifferent to our national values and we have a positive impact on the whole world with our highly innovative ideas.

2. The institute helps to create an attractive working environment for employees. Develops critical thinking skills in students. It finances and supports projects and ideas in cooperation with academic staff and scientists.

3.1 Tashkent Institute of Chemical Technology was named after the decision of the president of the Republic of Uzbekistan dated May 6, 1991 PF-203 (https://lex.uz/ru/docs/787853) formed mainly on the basis of the faculty of Chemical-Technology and engineering-technology of the former Tashkent Polytechnic Institute.We have experience between domestic and international partners as part of ERASMUS+ Programme projects. We participate in almost all projects within IUPAC every year. It participates SDG routes.

3.2 The Institute promotes the creation of an attractive working environment for employees. Develops skills based on critical thinking in students. Funds and supports projects and ideas in collaboration with scientific staff and scientists. In addition to internal and scientific activities, our institute also pays special attention to the environment and help to attract students to these projects.

3.3 It organizes separate scholarships, incentives and events in order to support students who need social support and are gifted. It provides students from foreign countries and other provinces with an institute dormitory.

Mission.name: Our mission: Training of high-potential specialists necessary for our society, increasing the quality and scope of scientific research, creating a high working environment for scientific staff, creating highly innovative projects by coordinating knowledge related to the field at the international level and implementing it on a global scale.
